intro: Coffea khasiana, commonly known as Khasi coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Eastern Himalayas, particularly in regions of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit, which resembles a cherry, contains two seeds used for coffee production. Due to its limited distribution and unique flavor profile, it is considered a rare and valuable species in the coffee world.
